Text

drawChar View Source

Draws a character to the screen buffer using OR logic (turns pixels ON).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

A

Character to print

B

Left margin

D, E

X, Y

Outputs

D, E

Moved to next character position

Notes

The left margin is only required if your string contains newlines or carriage returns.

drawCharAND View Source

Draws a character to the screen buffer using AND logic (turns pixels OFF).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

A

Character to print

B

Left margin

D, E

X, Y

Outputs

D, E

Moved to next character position

Notes

The left margin is only required if your string contains newlines or carriage returns.

drawCharXOR View Source

Draws a character to the screen buffer using XOR logic (inverts pixels).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

A

Character to print

B

Left margin

D, E

X, Y

Outputs

D, E

Moved to next character position

Notes

The left margin is only required if your string contains newlines or carriage returns.

drawDecA View Source

Draws the contents of A in decimal to the screen buffer using OR logic (turns pixels ON).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

D, E

X, Y

A

Value

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of next character

drawDecACIX View Source

Draws the contents of ACIX in decimal to the screen buffer using OR logic (turns pixels ON).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

D, E

X, Y

ACIX

Value

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of next character

drawDecHL View Source

Draws the contents of HL in decimal to the screen buffer using OR logic (turns pixels ON).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

D, E

X, Y

HL

Value

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of next character

drawHexA View Source

Draws the contents of A in hexadecimal to the screen buffer using OR logic (turns pixels ON).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

D, E

X, Y

A

Value

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of next character

drawHexHL View Source

Draws the contents of HL in hexadecimal to the screen buffer using OR logic (turns pixels ON).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

D, E

X, Y

HL

Value

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of next character

drawStr View Source

Draws a zero-delimited string to the screen buffer using OR logic (turns pixels ON).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

D, E

X, Y

B

Left margin

HL

String

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of the end of the string

Notes

The left margin is only required if your string contains newlines or carriage returns.

drawStrAND View Source

Draws a zero-delimited string to the screen buffer using AND logic (turns pixels OFF).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

D, E

X, Y

B

Left margin

HL

String

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of the end of the string

Notes

The left margin is only required if your string contains newlines or carriage returns.

drawStrXOR View Source

Draws a zero-delimited string to the screen buffer using XOR logic (inverts pixels).

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

D, E

X, Y

B

Left margin

HL

String

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of the end of the string

Notes

The left margin is only required if your string contains newlines or carriage returns.

measureChar View Source

Measures the width of a character in pixels.

Inputs

A

Character to measure

Outputs

A

Width of character

Notes

The height of each character is always 5 pixels. The width also often includes a column of empty pixels on the right (exceptions include '_').

measureStr View Source

Measures the width of a string in pixels.

Inputs

HL

String to measure

Outputs

A

Width of string

Notes

The height of any string is always 5 pixels. This function does not support newlines.

newline View Source

Advances D, E to the next line of text

Inputs

D, E

X, Y

B

Left margin

Outputs

D, E

Moved down one line and to the left margin

Notes

This is identical to (but faster than) calling drawChar with '\n'

wrapStr View Source

Draws a zero-delimited string to the screen buffer using OR logic (turns pixels ON), and wraps it inside a rectangle, with character breaks.

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

A

Left margin

B, C

X Limit, Y Limit

HL

String pointer

D, E

X, Y

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of the end of the string

HL

Pointer to null terminator or next character that would have been drawn if the string hadn't run off-screen.

Notes

The left margin is only required if your string contains newlines or carriage returns.

wrapStrAND View Source

Draws a zero-delimited string to the screen buffer using AND logic (turns pixels OFF), and wraps it inside a rectangle, with character breaks.

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

A

Left margin

B, C

X Limit, Y Limit

HL

String pointer

D, E

X, Y

Outputs

D, E

Advanced to position of the end of the string

HL

Pointer to null terminator or next character that would have been drawn if the string hadn't run off-screen.

Notes

The left margin is only required if your string contains newlines or carriage returns.

wrapStrXOR View Source

Draws a zero-delimited string to the screen buffer using XOR logic (inverts pixels), and wraps it inside a rectangle, with character breaks.

Inputs

IY

Screen buffer

A

Left margin

B, C

X Limit, Y Limit

HL

String pointer

Outputs
